meanings.definition: The state of being worn or frayed due to excessive use.
meanings.sent1: The threadbarenesses of the old carpet were evident from the numerous patches and thin spots.
meanings.sent2: The threadbarenesses of the sofa made it uncomfortable to sit on.
meanings.sent3: Despite its threadbarenesses, the blanket still provided warmth on chilly nights.
meanings.sent4: The threadbarenesses of the book's cover hinted at the many times it had been read.
meanings.sent5: The threadbarenesses of the fabric revealed its long history of use and love.

meanings.definition: The quality of being worn out or shabby in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The threadbarenesses of the curtains were noticeable as the sunlight shone through them.
meanings.sent2: The threadbarenesses of the tablecloth were a testament to years of family dinners.
meanings.sent3: Despite the threadbarenesses of his favorite shirt, he refused to part with it.
meanings.sent4: The threadbarenesses of the rug gave the room a cozy, lived-in feel.
meanings.sent5: The threadbarenesses of the jacket added a touch of vintage charm to his outfit.
